situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The bee is named Tarzan. The husky is named Tango. The lizard reveals a secret to the bee. The swallow is currently in Ankara. The worm is named Teddy. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: Here is an important piece of information about the swallow: if it is in Turkey at the moment then it pays money to the liger for sure. Rule2: The swallow will not pay some $$$ to the liger if it (the swallow) has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the worm's name. Rule3: If at least one animal dances with the poodle, then the liger does not swim in the pool next to the house of the mouse. Rule4: If the lizard reveals something that is supposed to be a secret to the bee and the ostrich dances with the bee, then the bee will not dance with the poodle. Rule5: Here is an important piece of information about the bee: if it has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the husky's name then it dances with the poodle for sure. Rule2 is preferred over Rule1. Rule4 is preferred over Rule5.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the liger swim in the pool next to the house of the mouse?
label: disproved
